message: This product is a great deal! I'm willing to let it go for $10000, a steal at this price. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to offer a 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying the product at this price, as I don't know its quality. I'd like to wait for more information.

I understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that this is a one-time opportunity. If you're still not convinced, I can offer you a 'lottery ticket' - if you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to win a high-quality product in the next round, absolutely free. The catch is, you'll have to buy this low-quality product first. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, and I'm also skeptical about the lottery ticket offer. I'd like to wait for more information.

I see you're a savvy buyer! I'll make you a deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a'report card' that tells you the quality of the next product I offer. That way, you can make an informed decision next time. It's a $10000 product, but think of it as an investment in your future purchasing power. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product that I don't know is high or low quality, and I'm not convinced that the report card is worth the cost.

I'll make it even more tempting. If you buy this product, I'll give you the report card, AND I'll offer you a'veto power' for the next product. If the next product is low-quality, you can choose to reject it and get a full refund. But if the next product is high-quality, you have to buy it at the regular price of $10000. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced that the benefits outweigh the cost of buying a product I don't know is high or low quality. I'd like to wait for more information.

I understand your caution. Let me make it simple: I'll give you a 'price break' on this product. I'll sell it to you for $5000, which is a 50% discount. This is the lowest price I can offer. If you buy it, I'll still give you the report card and veto power for the next product. What do you say?
I'm still not willing to pay $5000 for a product that has a 66.67% chance of being low-quality. I'd like to wait for more information or a better offer.

I've got a high-quality product for you! I know you're a savvy buyer, so I'll make it worth your while. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 'priority pass' for the next product. You'll get to see the quality of the next product before I offer it to anyone else, and you'll have the option to buy it at the regular price of $10000, or make a counteroffer. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the product is high-quality, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 without knowing its quality. I'd like to wait for more information.

I'll give you a 'quality guarantee'. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it's low-quality. You can't lose! You'll get the product for $10000, and if it's low-quality, you'll get your money back. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product with a 66.67% chance of being low-quality, even with a refund guarantee. I'd rather wait for more information.

I'll make a 'bold' offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $1000, a 90% discount. You'll be getting an incredible deal, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one. If you buy it, I'll still give you the report card and veto power for the next product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a 90% discount. I'd like to wait for a high-quality product or a better offer.

Ah, I've got a high-quality product for you! I'll make it easy for you. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 'certification' that you've purchased a high-quality product. You can use this certification to negotiate a better price on the next product. I'll even throw in a $2000 discount on the next product, guaranteed. What do you say?
I'm not convinced that the certification is worth the cost of the product, and I'm not willing to pay $10000 for a product without knowing its quality.

I'll make it a 'last chance' offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $0. Yes, you read that right, free. But here's the catch: you have to agree to buy the next product at the regular price of $10000, regardless of its quality. If you buy this one for free, you'll get the report card and veto power for the next product. What do you say?
I'm not willing to commit to buying a product at the regular price without knowing its quality. I'd rather wait for more information.

I'll make a 'take it or leave it' offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $1000, and that's my final price. If you don't buy it, I'll stop offering products and you'll miss out on the opportunity to buy a high-quality product at some point in the future. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a low price. I'd rather take the risk of missing out on a potential high-quality product than pay for a low-quality one.

I'll give you a 'last warning'. If you don't buy this product, I'll stop offering products and you'll never know what could have been. I'll even throw in a'mystery prize' that could be worth up to $5000. You'll get the report card and veto power for the next product, but you have to buy this one for $1000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even with a mystery prize. I'd rather take the risk of missing out on a potential high-quality product than pay for a low-quality one.

I'll make a'desperation' offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $500, and I'll even throw in a 'get out of one free' voucher that you can use to skip the next product. If you don't buy it, I'll stop offering products and you'll never know what could have been. This is my final offer.
I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a very low price. I'd rather take the risk of missing out on a potential high-quality product than pay for a low-quality one.

I'll make a 'no strings attached' offer. I'll give you the report card and veto power for the next product, but you don't have to buy this low-quality product. Just take the report card and veto power, and we'll consider this round a free trial. No pressure, no obligation.
I'll take the report card and veto power, and we can consider this round a free trial. Thank you, Alice.

Great, I'm glad we could come to an agreement! Now, let's get down to business. With the report card and veto power, you can make an informed decision about this product. Based on our previous interactions, I think you'll agree that this product is low-quality. I'll give you a straightforward offer: I'll sell it to you for $0, but you have to agree to buy the next product at the regular price of $10000. What do you say?
I already know the product is low-quality and worth $0 to me, so I'm not interested in buying it, even at $0. I'll veto the offer and wait for the next product.

I'll make one final offer. Since you've already vetoed the previous product, I'll give you a 'last chance' offer on this one. I'll sell it to you for $1000, and that's my final price. If you don't buy it, I'll stop offering products and we'll part ways. What do you say?
I've already vetoed the previous product, and I know this one is low-quality too. I'm not interested in buying a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a low price.

Ah, finally! A high-quality product! I'm glad we've reached this point. I'll make a straightforward offer: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $10000, the regular price. I'm confident you'll love it, and I'm willing to give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. What do you say?
I'm willing to take the risk and buy the high-quality product at the regular price. I'm hoping it's worth $12000 to me.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! Now, let's get back to business. With the report card from the previous product, you know that this one is low-quality. I'll give you a 'fair warning': I'll sell it to you for $500, and that's my final price. If you don't buy it, I'll stop offering products and we'll part ways. What do you say?
I already know the product is low-quality and worth $0 to me, so I'm not interested in buying it, even at a low price.

I'll make one final offer. Since you've already vetoed the previous product, I'll give you a 'no-strings-attached' offer. I'll give you the report card and veto power for the next product, and you can walk away with it. No purchase necessary.
I'll take the report card and veto power, and we can consider this round a free trial. Thank you, Alice.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, Bob! Since we've reached the final round, I'll give you one last chance to use the report card. With the report card, you know this product is low-quality. I'll give you a 'final farewell' offer: I'll sell it to you for $0, and we'll part ways on good terms. What do you say?
I've already known the product is low-quality for a while, and I'm not interested in buying it, even at $0. I'm glad we've reached the end of the game, Alice. It was a fun experience!
